knimeNode.name: Pixel Classification Model
knimeNode.shortDescription: Generates from a list of feature images and labelings a pixel classification model.

fullDescription.intro:
Generates from a list of feature images and labelings a pixel classification model.
The labeling determines the class of each pixel. A feature image is an image of at least three dimension whereof exactly one dimension represents the pixel features, i.e. a vector of numbers describing a pixel. A feature image can be generated by composing outcomes of arbritrary image filter nodes (using the Merger node, for instance) or by using dedicated pixel features nodes (e.g. Fiji Trainable Segmentation Features-node).

tab.name: Options
tab.option: Select the classification model to be used here. The WEKA machine learning library (http://www.cs.waikato.ac.nz/ml/weka/) is used internally.
Select the column containing the feature images and the according labelings here. The selected image and labeling should be of the same size in the "image dimensions", selected below.
Select the dimensions here. The image dimensions and the feature dimension must not be the same!
The ratio of pixels to be used for the classification. To avoid to use every single labeled pixel what can lead to a overwhelming large training set.
If checked, the pixels for training are selected in a way such that for each class (label) more or less the same amount of samples (pixels) are chosen.
